sections.title: READING
sections.passage: Digital nomadism has become increasingly popular in recent years, especially among young professionals seeking greater flexibility in their work-life balance. This lifestyle involves working remotely while traveling to different locations around the world, often staying in each place for weeks or months before moving on. While the concept sounds appealing, it comes with both significant advantages and considerable challenges. On the positive side, digital nomads enjoy unprecedented freedom to explore new cultures, learn languages, and expand their global perspective. They can escape traditional office constraints and often find their creativity enhanced by changing environments. Many report feeling more motivated and productive when working from inspiring locations. However, the lifestyle also presents substantial difficulties. Maintaining consistent internet connectivity can be problematic in some destinations, potentially affecting work quality and client relationships. Time zone differences create scheduling challenges for meetings and collaboration. Additionally, the constant movement can lead to feelings of isolation and difficulty in forming deep, lasting relationships. Financial planning becomes more complex, as nomads must budget for travel expenses while managing irregular income streams. Furthermore, legal considerations such as visa requirements, tax obligations, and health insurance coverage vary significantly between countries, requiring careful research and planning.

parts.text: Climate change is one of (6) ______ most pressing issues of our time. Scientists have been warning us for decades that global temperatures are rising due to human activities. Many countries are now taking action to reduce (7) ______ carbon emissions, but progress has been slow. If we had started addressing this problem earlier, we (8) ______ have prevented some of the damage we see today. Renewable energy sources like solar and wind power are becoming (9) ______ popular as technology improves and costs decrease. However, we still need to do much more (10) ______ we want to avoid catastrophic consequences for future generations.

questions.question: 6. A the B a C some D many
7. A they B them C their D there
8. A will B would C might D should
9. A more B most C much D many
10. A unless B if C because D although
